name: politico
text:
Portland may just be the beginning.

DHS officials have considered deploying mobile field forces to protect federal property in cities around the U.S. that experience unrest
https://t.co/CR7lf7GNT1

name: politico
text:
And the DOJ is planning to expand “Operation Legend,” a law enforcement initiative launched by AG Bill Barr earlier this month to fight “the sudden surge of violent crime” in Kansas City, Mo
https://t.co/CR7lf7GNT1

name: politico
text:
Get quick, digestible facts and insight on the news of the day by tuning in to POLITICO Dispatch. Subscribe and start listening today.
https://t.co/DPUpEFlsul https://t.co/MgpgHKwCSP

name: politico
text:
The discussions follow weeks of clashes between federal agents and protesters in Portland, which Trump called “worse than Afghanistan.” 

He has vowed to use the power of the federal government to crush what his officials deem “violent anarchists”
https://t.co/CR7lf7GNT1

name: politico
text:
The threat of force against cities whose residents overwhelmingly oppose Trump has outraged Democratic lawmakers and mayors, several of whom told us they have yet to receive a formal heads-up about any forthcoming deployments
https://t.co/CR7lf7GNT1

name: politico
text:
GOP senators are rejecting Joe Biden's amped-up public warnings about Russian interference in this year's presidential election.

"I think to sound an alarm is to be ignorant of everything that we’ve done since 2016," said Sen. Richard Burr
https://t.co/fWZxJmOCB0
